meanings.definition: The quality of being relentless or unyielding.
meanings.sent1: Her inexorablenesses in pursuing her goals inspired others to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The inexorablenesses of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent3: Despite her small size, her inexorablenesses in debates made her a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood with the inexorablenesses of time, unmoved by the changing world around it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inexorablenesses in pushing her students to excel led to great academic achievements.

meanings.definition: The state of being unchangeable or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The inexorablenesses of the rules made it difficult to introduce any changes.
meanings.sent2: His beliefs were marked by an inexorablenesses that made compromise impossible.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inexorablenesses in demanding treats at 6 am every morning was both annoying and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood in the garden, a symbol of the family's inexorablenesses through generations.
meanings.sent5: The fortress was built with an inexorablenesses that made it impervious to enemy attacks.
